conclusion: Analyze the given information and the provided graph to determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second.
The graph shows the relationship between x/t (position divided by time) and t (time).
At t = 0, x/t is not defined because division by zero is undefined.
As t approaches zero from the positive side, x/t approaches a value.
At t = -2 seconds, x/t = 0, indicating x = 0 when t = -2.
At t = 0, the dashed line indicates a point where x/t = 10 m/s.
As t approaches zero, x/t approaches 10 m/s.
The slope of the line represents the rate of change of x/t with respect to t.
Calculate the slope using points (-2, 0) and (0, 10): slope = 5 m/s^2.
The equation of the line is x/t = 5t + 10.
Multiply both sides by t to get x(t) = 5t^2 + 10t.
The speed v(t) is the derivative of x(t) with respect to t: v(t) = 10t + 10.
Substitute t = 2 into the speed equation: v(2) = 30 m/s.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 30 m/s.
